DOC.brief_summary: The aim study ass whether renal impairment could affect fevipiprant pharmacokinetics ( PK ) extent dosage adjustment appropriate patient population . The study also aim determine effect dialysis fevipiprant pharmacokinetic profile procedure might remove significant fraction drug .
DOC.brief_title: Pharmacokinetics Safety Fevipiprant Patients With Renal Impairment Compared Matched Healthy Subjects
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose study determine pharmacokinetic profile fevipiprant different patient renal impariment compare healthy match volunteer extent would require adjustment dosage . Data study use guide enrollment criterion future clinical trial support regulatory submission label information
DOC.criteria: Healthy subject must satisfy criterion normal renal function evidence normal Glomerular Filtration Rate ( GFR ) : eGFR ≥ 90 mL/min/1.73m2 ; healthy subject must match age ( +/ 10years ) , gender , smoke status , weight ( +/ 15 % ) , patient renail impair patient group : A body mass index ( BMI ) within range 18 36 kg/m2 ESRD patient hemodialysis : glomerulo filtration rat GFR < 15 mL/min/1.73 m2 patient severe renal impairment : GFR < 30 mL/min/1.73m2 ( without need hemodialysis ) ; patient moderate renal impairment : 30 mL/min/1.73m2 ≤ eGFR < 60 mL/min/1.73m2 ; patient mild impairment : 60 mL/min/1.73m2 ≤ eGFR < 90 mL/min/1.73m2 Pregnant nursing ( lactate ) woman History evidence inherit bilirubin disease disorder subject participate another study malignancy past Hemoglobin level 10 g/dL screen HIV positiv Heavy smoker ( ≥20 cigarette per day ) Liver disease , indicate ALT , γGT , AST alkaline phosphatase exceed twice upper limit normal stable ( e.g . increase liver value know previous patient record ) . Serum bilirubin > 27 μmol/L ( 1.6 mg/dL ) Clinically significant ECG change and/or arrhythmias Chronic infection Hepatitis B ( HBV ) Hepatitis C ( HCV )
